property.name: DatasourceConfigurer
property.description: The fully qualified name of a class implementing org.appng.core.repository.config.DatasourceConfigurer, which is responsible for JDBC connection-pooling. Supported are 'org.appng.core.repository.config.HikariCPConfigurer' and 'org.appng.core.repository.config.TomcatJdbcConfigurer'

property.name: allowSkipRender
property.description: Allow skipping of the render phase using render=false for the manager GUI or the XSLT based rendering of taglets.

property.name: appendTabId
property.description: If set to true, the name of the currently selected tab is being appended to the URL as a get-parameter. Addresses the issue that IE loses the anchor on a redirect.

property.name: assetsDir
property.description: A semicolon-separated list of folder-names (relative to 'wwwDir') containing static resources such as images or pdfs

property.name: authApplication
property.description: The name of the application which is responsible for the authentication

property.name: authLoginPage
property.description: The names of the login-pages (comma-separated) within the application defined in 'authApplication'. The number of comma-separated pages must be the same as in 'authLoginRef', because 'authLoginRef[n]' refers to 'authLoginPage[n]'!

property.name: authLoginRef
property.description: The action names (comma-separated) for the pages defined in {@link #AUTH_LOGIN_PAGE}. The number of comma-separated names must be the same as in 'authLoginPage', because 'authLoginRef[n]' refers to 'authLoginPage[n]'!

property.name: authLogoutActionName
property.description: The name for the parameter defining the action on the logout-page

property.name: authLogoutActionValue
property.description: The value for the parameter defining the action on the logout-page

property.name: authLogoutPage
property.description: The name of the logout-page within the application defined in 'authApplication'

property.name: authLogoutRef
property.description: The reference-path for the logout-action

property.name: csrfProtectedMethods
property.description: a comma-separated list of HTTP-methods to enable CSRF protection for

property.name: csrfProtectedPaths
property.description: a comma-separated list of path-prefixes to enable CSRF protection for

property.name: csrfProtectionEnabled
property.description: Set to true to enable CSRF-protection for this site

property.name: defaultApplication
property.description: The application to be called after a successful login

property.name: defaultPage
property.description: The name of the default-page (without extension) relative to one of the directories defined in 'documentDir'

property.name: defaultPageSize
property.description: The default page size (items per page)

property.name: documentDir
property.description: A semicolon-separated list of folder-names (relative to 'wwwDir') containing JSP-files and static resources

property.name: ehcacheBlockingTimeout
property.description: The time, in milliseconds, to wait for the filter before a LockTimeoutException is thrown

property.name: ehcacheClearOnShutdown
property.description: Whether or not the Ehcache is cleared on a site shutdown/reload

property.name: ehcacheEnabled
property.description: Set to true to enable Ehcache for this site

property.name: ehcacheExceptions
property.description: URL path prefixes which are never cached. Contains one prefix per line (CLOB value).

property.name: ehcacheStatistics
property.description: Set to true to enable Ehcache statistics

property.name: encoding
property.description: The encoding for file-resources

property.name: enforcePrimaryDomain
property.description: Set to true to enforce the protocol used by the site (http or https)

property.name: errorPage
property.description: The name of the default error-page (without extension) relative to 'wwwDir'

property.name: errorPages
property.description: The name of the error-page per document-directory (see 'documentDir'), multiple entries separated by a pipe (|)

property.name: host
property.description: The host of the site. For convenience only, do not change!

property.name: indexConfig
property.description: For each directory defined in 'documentDir', there can be defined which locale and which Lucene-analyzer to use for indexing.

property.name: indexDir
property.description: The folder containing the Lucene-Index, relative to 'wwwDir'

property.name: indexFileSystemQueueSize
property.description: the queue size used per directory when indexing the file system

property.name: indexFileTypes
property.description: A list of comma-separated file-extensions (without leading dot) which are being indexed

property.name: indexQueueSize
property.description: The queue size used for document indexing

property.name: indexTimeout
property.description: The timeout in milliseconds for indexing

property.name: ldapDomain
property.description: The Domain for the LDAP authentication

property.name: ldapGroupBaseDn
property.description: The base-DN for LDAP-groups

property.name: ldapHost
property.description: The LDAP host in provider URL format ("ldap(s)://<host>:<port>"). Note that you might need to add CA certificates to the truststore of the executing JVM if you enable "ldaps://".

property.name: ldapIdAttribute
property.description: The name of the LDAP-attribute containing the user-id used for authentication

property.name: ldapPassword
property.description: Password of the LDAP service-user

property.name: ldapPrincipalScheme
property.description: How the LDAP principal is built from a given username when logging in. ["DN": results in "${site.ldapIdAttribute}=>username<,${site.ldapUserBaseDn}" - "UPN": results in ">username<@${site.ldapDomain}" - "SAM": results in "${site.ldapDomain}\\\\>username<"]. "UPN" and "SAM" are ActiveDirectory specific and "SAM" is the default to stay backward compatible.

property.name: ldapStartTls
property.description: Use STARTTLS for the LDAP connection.

property.name: ldapUser
property.description: The name of the LDAP service-user for general LDAP lookups. If the value is a Distinguished Name (e.g. "cn=Service User,dc=mycompany,dc=com") it will be used directly as LDAP principal. Otherwise the principal will be derived according to the value specified for ${site.ldapPrincipalScheme}.

property.name: ldapUserBaseDn
property.description: The base-DN which is used to map a plain username to a Distinguished Name, if "DN" is used as principal scheme (see property "ldapPrincipalScheme").

property.name: locale
property.description: The default locale for the site. Use one of java.util.Locale.getAvailableLocales()

property.name: mailDisabled
property.description: Set to 'true' to disable mailing and log the e-mails instead.

property.name: mailHost
property.description: The mail-host to use.

property.name: mailPort
property.description: The mail-port to use

property.name: manager-path
property.description: The path-suffix for the appNG-Webapplication

property.name: name
property.description: The name of the site. For convenience only, do not change!

property.name: rewriteConfig
property.description: the location of the rewrite rules for UrlRewriteFilter (http://tuckey.org/urlrewrite), relative to 'siteRootDir'.

property.name: searchChunkSize
property.description: The chunksize (items per page) for the search-tag

property.name: searchMaxHits
property.description: The maximum number of hits for the search-tag

property.name: service-path
property.description: The path-suffix for the services offered by appNG (such as Webservices, SOAP, Actions, Datasources)

property.name: serviceOutputFormat
property.description: The output format to be used when actions/datasources are being called through service URLs

property.name: serviceOutputType
property.description: The output type to be used when actions/datasources are being called through service URLs

property.name: siteRootDir
property.description: The absolute path to the sites root-directory

property.name: supportReloadFile
property.description: If true, a site reload is performed when a file named .reload is created in the site's root directory.

property.name: supportedLanguages
property.description: A comma-separated list of the languages supported by the site.

property.name: tagPrefix
property.description: The prefix used for the appNG JSP-tags.

property.name: template
property.description: The name of the template to use

property.name: timeZone
property.description: The default timezone for the site. Use one of java.util.TimeZone.getAvailableIDs().

property.name: wwwDir
property.description: The name of the folder containing the web-contents, relative to 'repositoryPath' configured at the platform

property.name: xssExceptions
property.description: URL path prefixes where XSS protection is omitted. Contains one prefix per line (CLOB value). Supports blank lines and comments (#).
